Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi everyone,

I'm trying to replicate the behavior of the paper 'Unshacklin=
g
Evolution: Evolving Soft Robots with Multiple Materials and a Powerful
Ge=
nerative Encoding' by Nick Cheney, Robert MacCurdy, Jeff Clune and
Hod Lips=
on.

The difference is that instead of using soft bodies, I'm using soft
di=
stance joints, and instead of 3D, I'm using 2D.

I have a simulation up and=
 running using a 10x10 2D grid of
interconnected bodies, and the material t=
ype of each body determines
the behavior of each connection to the body. My=
 problem is that I
would like the 10x10 grid to have material types selecte=
d by an ANN
using NEAT and CPPN such that I get symmetry and repetitions in=
 the
material selection.

I'm pretty much completely new to this field, so =
I need an expert that
can help me with the implementation (I'm currently us=
ing SharpNEAT in C#).

Anyone willing to help me out? I can pay for the con=
sultation.

-- 
Best Regards,
Ian Qvist
